abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Tax
            Administration Modernization Project (TAMP II) for Russian
            Federation were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: high-level Government and Federal Tax
            Service (FTS) ownership of the project and tax
            administration reforms remained consistently high.
            Importantly, technical-level ownership and change management
            within the FTS was embedded through thematic working groups
            in Ministry of Taxes and Fees (MinTax) and then the FTS.
            These working groups penetrated very deep into the operating
            levels of the tax administration and provided strong
            continuity even through wrenching organizational
            restructurings and changes in MinTax and FTS leadership. The
            working groups also functioned, contrary to conventional
            wisdom which sometimes doubts the efficacy of such change
            agents internal to an organization, as key channels to
            introduce and sustain incremental institutional change,
            modernized business processes, and related automation. It
            appears that the high organizational pride and esprit de
            corps so manifest across the entire FTS contributed
            significantly to this achievement. The importance of the
            thematic working groups in keeping the banners of ownership,
            change management and incremental reforms flying through
            difficult times cannot be over-estimated.
